4380/A0/05/113/002.indicator_name: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
4380/A0/05/113/002.headline: UNICEF successfully advocated for a separate justice for children budget allocation of USD 3.7 million in the new JLOS Sector Development Plan  2017-2021. 285 (55%) out of 519 children in conflict with the law charged with non-capital offenses were diverted from formal justice proceedings in 24 priority districts.
4380/A0/05/113/002.baseline_value: Draft guidelines and standards for diversion 2016  Management of remand homes  DPP handbook 2016  workflow process - 2015

4380/A0/05/113/002.status_value: In the Children Amendment Act 2016 it is stipulated that a child has the right to express his or her view  belief and opinion on any matter that affects his or her wellbeing. Review of ICT legislation and recommendations for revising child friendly procedures  including on online child sexual abuse is now nearly finalized.	Sector Review(s)
4380/A0/05/113/002.indicator_name: Existence of legislation  that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)
4380/A0/05/113/002.headline: UNICEF successfully advocated for a separate justice for children budget allocation of USD 3.7 million in the new JLOS Sector Development Plan  2017-2021. 285 (55%) out of 519 children in conflict with the law charged with non-capital offenses were diverted from formal justice proceedings in 24 priority districts.

4380/A0/05/113/002.status_value: The diversion guidelines are still in draft and need to be revised to meet international standards. Furthermore the regulations for the implementation of the diversion guidelines are still to be finalized. UNICEF is providing technical assistance through an international consultant to the Ministry to finalize the guidelines and regulations and to ensure that they are in line with the minimum standards laid in the Beijing Rules of Justice
4380/A0/05/113/002.indicator_name: Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Beijing Rules of Justice
4380/A0/05/113/002.headline: UNICEF successfully advocated for a separate justice for children budget allocation of USD 3.7 million in the new JLOS Sector Development Plan  2017-2021. 285 (55%) out of 519 children in conflict with the law charged with non-capital offenses were diverted from formal justice proceedings in 24 priority districts.
4380/A0/05/113/002.target_value: Statutory instrument on diversion of children in conflict with law published

4380/A0/05/113/002.status_value: In 2017  so far  support to JLOS resulted in the diversion of 2 381 (77%) cases of children in conflict with the law from formal justice proceedings out of 3 090 cases that were eligible for diversion in 53 districts. In the  24 out of the 27  priority districts  where data on diversion is available the total number of children diverted is 285 (55%) out of 519 divertible cases. This indicates the need to focus more on our priority districts.
4380/A0/05/113/002.indicator_name: % and # of children accused of non-capital offences who are diverted before or during formal proceedings
4380/A0/05/113/002.headline: UNICEF successfully advocated for a separate justice for children budget allocation of USD 3.7 million in the new JLOS Sector Development Plan  2017-2021. 285 (55%) out of 519 children in conflict with the law charged with non-capital offenses were diverted from formal justice proceedings in 24 priority districts.
